result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara M Olds/McGeshick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 11:33 AM. Also called 14CF04. Sara Olds appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Olds. State appears by Charles Simono. State - here to resolve both matters - dismiss and read in 14CF04 enitrely - plead G to count #1 as alleged, acknowledge 4 priors, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: count #1 - 365 days in FC jail, $2400.00 fine, DL revocation of 36 months, AODA and IID, #2 - DRI; condition of probation to include: AODA, absolute sobriety, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Roley and Olds agree - provides court with plea questionnaire. Olds pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court DRI count #2 and dismisses and reads in all counts on 14CF04. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has filed 4 exhibits regarding prior convictions and certified driving record - follow joint recommendation. Roley makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for time to report. Olds withholds comment. State also asks for $35.00 blood draw costs to be reimbursed. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 16 days only if revoked - report today, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, $2400.00 fine - paid thru probation, $35.00 blood draw cost - paid thru probation, 36 month DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles for 3 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting each week, 100 hours of community service - to be completed within first 6 months after released from incarceration, submit DNA sample with no surcharge assessed, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Preliminary hearing on January 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 11:44 AM. Sara Olds appears via video from FOSO and specially by Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley has complaint but has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant. Olds states she has not received the complaint. State will get it to her, handed to court officer Thornton to give to defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Roley waives further reading, requests PH and within time limits. Court continues bond, set for PH on 1/15/14 at 3:00 PM. Roley - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court continues bond at this point. The defendant's other matter is set for a #1 JT on 1/16/14 at this time.
